name: Mixed Greens with Sun-Dried Tomato Dressing
instructions: Soak the sun-dried tomatoes in soy milk for an hour.
Chop fresh herbs, tomato, and onions and toss them with the salad greens.
Grind the soaked sun-dried tomatoes with additional veggies as desired.
Add lemon zest to enhance flavor.
Combine all ingredients in a high-powered blender until they are smooth and creamy.

name: Toasts with Tomato, Onion, & Hummus
instructions: Toast the bread slices until they are golden brown.
Spread hummus evenly on each slice of toast.
Top with tomato slices and onion slices.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve immediately.

name: Ham, Egg and Spinach Roll-ups
instructions: Beat the eggs in a bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Heat a non-stick skillet with a little olive oil over medium heat.
Pour in the eggs and cook until they are set, then remove from heat.
Lay a slice of ham flat and place some spinach on top.
Roll the cooked egg with the ham and spinach into a tight roll.
Repeat with the remaining ingredients and serve warm.

name: Strawberry and Cherry Pancake
instructions: In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and baking soda.
Whisk in buttermilk, egg, and melted butter until smooth.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Pour batter into the skillet, using about 1/4 cup for each pancake.
Top each pancake with strawberries and cherries before flipping.
Cook until golden brown and serve warm with syrup.

name: Copycat California Pizza Kitchen BBQ Chicken
instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Spread BBQ sauce evenly over the pizza crust.
Top with shredded chicken, mozzarella cheese, and red onion slices.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.
Garnish with cilantro before serving.

name: Green Smoothie drink
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Add more almond milk if needed to reach the desired consistency.
Serve immediately and enjoy.

name: Onion Rings
instructions: Heat the oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 375°F.
Separate onion slices into rings.
In one bowl, mix flour, salt, and pepper. In another, pour buttermilk. Place breadcrumbs in a third bowl.
Dip each onion ring in flour, then buttermilk, and finally coat with breadcrumbs.
Fry the onion rings until golden brown, about 3 minutes.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

name: Chicken Ranch Wrap
instructions: Warm the tortillas in a microwave or skillet.
Spread ranch dressing evenly on each tortilla.
Layer shredded chicken, lettuce, tomatoes, and cheese on top.
Roll up the tortillas tightly and slice in half.
Serve immediately or wrap in foil for later.

name: Tuna Mex Tuna Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine tuna, corn, black beans, tomatoes, and red onion.
Add lime juice, cilantro, salt, and pepper.
Toss until well mixed.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.

name: Cherry-Berry Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: Granola and fresh fruit for topping
instructions: In a blender, combine mixed berries, cherries, banana, yogurt, almond milk, and honey.
Blend until smooth and thick.
Pour into a bowl and top with granola and fresh fruit.
Serve immediately.

name: Grilled Red Snapper
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Brush snapper fillets with olive oil.
Season with garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Grill the fillets for 8-10 minutes per side, until the fish is opaque and flakes easily.
Serve with lemon wedges.

name: Strawberry and Walnut Spinach Salad
instructions: In a large salad bowl, combine spinach, strawberries, and walnuts.
Drizzle with balsamic vinaigrette and toss to coat.
Top with crumbled feta cheese and serve immediately.

name: Green Goddess Wrap
instructions: Spread hummus evenly over each tortilla.
Layer avocado, cucumber, sprouts, carrots, and spinach on top.
Season with salt and pepper.
Roll up the tortillas tightly and slice in half.
Serve immediately.

name: Spinach and Cheese Pasta
instructions: Cook the pasta according to package instructions and drain.
In a large skillet, sauté spinach until wilted.
Add ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Mix in the cooked pasta and toss until well combined.
Serve hot.

name: Truffle Popcorn
instructions: Pop the popcorn kernels using an air popper or stovetop method.
Drizzle with truffle oil and toss to coat.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and salt.
Serve immediately.

name: Healthy Banana Pancake
instructions: Mash the banana in a bowl.
Add eggs, oats, cinnamon, vanilla extract, and baking powder.
Mix until well combined.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and pour the batter to form small pancakes.
Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown.
Serve hot.

name: Creamy Cajun Chicken Pasta
instructions: Cook the pasta according to package instructions and drain.
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat and cook the chicken until browned.
Add Cajun seasoning and stir well.
Pour in the heavy cream and bring to a simmer.
Stir in Parmesan cheese and cook until the sauce thickens.
Mix in the cooked pasta and toss until coated.
Serve hot.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large bowl, cream together butter, sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla.
Combine flour, baking soda, and salt; gradually blend into the creamed mixture.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 8 to 10 minutes, until edges are golden brown.
Cool on wire racks.

name: Caesar Salad
instructions: In a large salad bowl, combine chopped romaine lettuce and croutons.
Drizzle with Caesar dressing and lemon juice.
Toss to coat evenly.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.

name: Avocado Toast with Eggs
instructions: Toast the bread slices.
Mash the avocado and spread evenly on the toasted bread.
Cook eggs to your preference (sunny side up or scrambled).
Place eggs on top of the avocado toast.
Season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes if desired.
Serve immediately.

name: Overnight Oats with Berries
instructions: In a jar or container, combine oats, almond milk, Greek yogurt, and honey.
Stir well to combine.
Refrigerate overnight.
Top with mixed berries before serving.

name: Spinach and Mushroom Frittata
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, heat olive oil and sauté mushrooms until tender.
Add spinach and cook until wilted.
In a bowl, whisk eggs, cheese, salt, and pepper.
Add the spinach and mushroom mixture to the bowl and mix.
Pour into a greased oven-safe skillet and bake for 20 minutes or until eggs are set.
Serve warm.

name: Greek Yogurt Parfait
instructions: In a glass or bowl, layer Greek yogurt, granola, and mixed berries.
Drizzle with honey.
Repeat layers as desired.
Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to eat.

name: Quinoa Salad with Black Beans
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let cool.
In a large bowl, combine quinoa, black beans, corn, red bell pepper, and cilantro.
Add lime juice, salt, and pepper.
Mix well and serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Chicken Caesar Wrap
instructions: Warm tortillas in a skillet or microwave.
Spread Caesar dressing on each tortilla.
Layer with chicken, lettuce, and Parmesan cheese.
Roll up tightly and slice in half.
Serve immediately.

name: Veggie Stir-Fry with Tofu
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add tofu cubes and cook until golden brown.
Add bell pepper, broccoli, and snap peas. Stir-fry until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Stir in soy sauce and sesame oil.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.

name: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Tacos
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and diced
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss sweet potatoes with olive oil and roast for 20 minutes or until tender.
Warm tortillas in a skillet or microwave.
Fill each tortilla with roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, avocado slices, and salsa.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve.

name: Baked Salmon with Asparagus
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Place salmon fillets and asparagus on a baking sheet.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Top salmon with lemon slices.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until salmon is cooked through and asparagus is tender.
Serve immediately.

name: Beef Stroganoff
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Add beef and cook until browned. Remove from skillet.
Add onions and mushrooms to the same skillet and cook until softened.
Return beef to the skillet and sprinkle with flour.
Stir in beef broth and bring to a simmer.
Stir in sour cream and cook until sauce thickens.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve over noodles or rice.

name: Chicken Parmesan
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Dredge chicken in flour, dip in beaten egg, then coat with a mixture of breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese.
Place chicken in a baking dish and bake for 20 minutes.
Top with marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese.
Bake for an additional 10 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve hot.

name: Vegetable Curry
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, and cook until softened.
Stir in curry powder and cook for 1 minute.
Add carrots, potatoes, and cauliflower. Cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
Cook until vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve with rice.

name: Stuffed Mushrooms
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Remove stems from mushrooms and set aside.
In a bowl, mix cream cheese, Parmesan cheese, garlic, parsley, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each mushroom cap with the cheese mixture.
Place mushrooms on a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes until mushrooms are tender and filling is golden.
Serve warm.

name: Bruschetta
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place baguette slices on a baking sheet and toast for 3-5 minutes.
In a bowl, combine tomatoes, basil, garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Top toasted baguette slices with tomato mixture.
Serve immediately.

name: Guacamole
instructions: In a bowl, mash avocados with a fork.
Mix in onion, tomatoes, jalapeño, lime juice, and salt.
Serve with tortilla chips or as a topping for other dishes.

name: Hummus with Pita Chips
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cut pita bread into wedges and place on a baking sheet.
Brush with olive oil and sprinkle with paprika and salt.
Bake for 8-10 minutes until crispy.
Serve with hummus.

name: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, olives, and feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine.
Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to eat.

name: Cobb Salad
instructions: In a large salad bowl, layer mixed greens, chicken, eggs, avocado, bacon, and blue cheese.
Drizzle with ranch dressing and toss gently.
Serve immediately.

name: Asian Noodle Salad
instructions: Cook rice noodles according to package instructions. Drain and cool.
In a large bowl, combine noodles, cabbage, carrots, green onions, and sesame seeds.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, and sesame oil.
Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine.
Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to eat.

name: Caprese Salad
instructions: Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on a platter.
Tuck basil leaves between the tomato and mozzarella slices.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.

name: Margherita Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface.
Transfer dough to a pizza stone or baking sheet.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over dough.
Top with mozzarella slices.
Bake for 10-15 minutes until crust is golden and cheese is melted.
Remove from oven and top with fresh basil leaves and a drizzle of olive oil.
Serve hot.

name: Pepperoni Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface.
Transfer dough to a pizza stone or baking sheet.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over dough.
Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and top with pepperoni slices.
Bake for 10-15 minutes until crust is golden and cheese is melted.
Drizzle with olive oil before serving.

name: Vegetable Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface.
Transfer dough to a pizza stone or baking sheet.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over dough.
Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and top with vegetables.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until crust is golden and cheese is melted.
Drizzle with olive oil before serving.

name: BBQ Chicken Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface.
Transfer dough to a pizza stone or baking sheet.
Spread BBQ sauce evenly over dough.
Top with mozzarella cheese, chicken, and red onion slices.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until crust is golden and cheese is melted.
Top with fresh cilantro before serving.

name: Berry Banana Smoothie
instructions: In a blender, combine banana, mixed berries, Greek yogurt, almond milk, and honey.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

name: Green Smoothie
instructions: In a blender, combine spinach, cucumber, apple, pineapple, and coconut water.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

name: Mango Smoothie
instructions: In a blender, combine mango, banana, Greek yogurt, orange juice, and agave syrup.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

name: Tropical Smoothie
instructions: In a blender, combine pineapple, mango, coconut milk, spinach, and honey.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a skillet, cook pancetta until crispy. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs and Parmesan cheese.
Drain spaghetti and toss with pancetta and garlic.
Remove from heat and quickly stir in egg mixture until creamy.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve immediately.

name: Pesto Pasta
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions.
Drain and toss with pesto sauce.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and pine nuts.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve immediately.

name: Fettuccine Alfredo
instructions: Cook fettuccine according to package instructions.
In a skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in cream and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add Parmesan cheese and stir until melted and smooth.
Toss pasta with sauce, and season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.

name: Baked Ziti
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cook ziti according to package instructions.
In a skillet, heat olive oil and cook garlic until fragrant.
Combine cooked ziti with marinara sauce, ricotta, and half of the mozzarella cheese.
Transfer to a baking dish and top with remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until bubbly and golden.
Serve hot.

name: Chicken Noodle Soup
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, and cook until softened.
Add carrots and celery, and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Add chicken, egg noodles, and bay leaf. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

name: Tomato Basil Soup
instructions: In a pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, and cook until translucent.
Add crushed tomatoes and vegetable broth. Bring to a simmer.
Stir in basil leaves and cook for 10 minutes.
Blend soup with an immersion blender until smooth. Stir in heavy cream.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

name: Butternut Squash Soup
instructions: In a pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, and cook until softened.
Add butternut squash and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Blend soup with an immersion blender until smooth. Stir in coconut milk and nutmeg.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

name: Lentil Soup
instructions: In a pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, and cook until softened.
Add carrot and celery, and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in lentils and pour in vegetable broth. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 25 minutes until lentils are tender.
Season with cumin, salt, and pepper. Serve hot.

name: Chocolate Lava Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Grease and flour four ramekins.
In a microwave-safe bowl, melt butter and chocolate together until smooth.
Whisk in powdered sugar until combined.
Add eggs and egg yolks, and whisk until smooth.
Fold in flour until just combined.
Divide batter among ramekins and bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are set but centers are soft.
Let cool for 1 minute, then run a knife around the edges and invert onto plates.

name: Lemon Bars
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x9 inch baking dish.
In a bowl, combine 1 cup flour and powdered sugar. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Press mixture into the bottom of the prepared dish and bake for 15 minutes.
In another bowl, whisk together eggs, granulated sugar, 1/4 cup flour, and lemon juice.
Pour over baked crust and return to oven. Bake for an additional 20-25 minutes.
Let cool completely, then dust with powdered sugar before cutting into bars.

name: Apple Crumble
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a baking dish.
In a bowl, toss apples with 1/2 cup sugar and lemon juice. Transfer to the prepared dish.
In another bowl, combine flour, 1/2 cup sugar, brown sugar, butter, and cinnamon. Mix until crumbly.
Sprinkle mixture over apples.
Bake for 35-40 minutes until topping is golden and apples are tender.

name: Vanilla Pudding
instructions: In a saucepan, whisk together sugar, cornstarch, and salt.
Gradually whisk in milk and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture comes to a boil and thickens.
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract.
Pour into serving dishes and let cool. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

name: Vegan Buddha Bowl
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
In a skillet, heat olive oil and sauté broccoli until tender.
In bowls, layer quinoa, chickpeas, broccoli, cherry tomatoes, and avocado.
Drizzle with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.

name: Vegan Tacos
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add black beans, corn, and bell pepper. Cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in taco seasoning and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Fill taco shells with the mixture and top with avocado and cilantro.
Serve immediately.

name: Vegan Chocolate Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a cake pan.
In a bowl, combine flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together almond milk, vegetable oil, apple cider vinegar, and vanilla extract.
Combine wet and dry ingredients and mix until smooth.
Pour into prepared pan and bake for 30 minutes.
Cool before serving.

name: Stuffed Bell Peppers
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut tops off bell peppers and remove seeds.
In a bowl, combine quinoa, black beans, corn, tomatoes, cilantro, olive oil, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Stuff peppers with the mixture and place in a baking dish.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until peppers are tender.

name: Grilled Salmon
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Brush salmon fillets with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Place salmon on the grill and cook for 4-5 minutes per side.
During the last minute, place lemon slices and garlic on the grill.
Serve with fresh dill and lemon slices.

name: Shrimp Scampi
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: In a skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add shrimp and cook until pink and opaque, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Stir in white wine and lemon juice, and cook for another 2 minutes.
Season with salt, pepper, and parsley. Serve immediately.

name: Baked Cod
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a baking dish.
Brush cod fillets with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
In a bowl, mix breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, and oregano. Press mixture onto cod fillets.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until fish flakes easily with a fork.

name: Seafood Paella
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and bell pepper. Cook until softened.
Stir in rice and cook for 2 minutes.
Add chicken broth and white wine. Bring to a simmer.
Stir in shrimp, mussels, and clams. Cook for 15-20 minutes until rice is tender and seafood is cooked.
Season with paprika, saffron, salt, and pepper. Serve hot.

name: Grilled BBQ Chicken
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Brush chicken breasts with olive oil and season with smoked paprika, salt, and pepper.
Grill chicken for 6-7 minutes per side, brushing with BBQ sauce during the last few minutes of cooking.
Serve with additional BBQ sauce on the side.

name: Grilled Veggie Skewers
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Thread vegetables onto skewers.
Brush with olive oil and sprinkle with oregano, salt, and pepper.
Grill for 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until vegetables are tender and slightly charred.
Serve warm.

name: Grilled Portobello Mushrooms
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
In a bowl, mix balsamic vinegar, olive oil, garlic, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Brush mushrooms with the mixture.
Grill mushrooms for 5 minutes per side, until tender and grill marks appear.
Serve immediately.

name: Grilled Shrimp Skewers
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: Preheat grill to high heat.
In a bowl, toss shrimp with olive oil, garlic, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper.
Thread shrimp onto skewers.
Grill for 2-3 minutes per side, until shrimp are pink and opaque.
Serve hot.

name: Classic Chocolate Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
In a large bowl, mix flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add eggs, milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract. Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes.
Stir in boiling water until the batter is smooth.
Pour batter into prepared pans and bake for 30 minutes.
Cool in pans for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before frosting.

name: Lemon Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour an 8-inch round cake pan.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then stir in the lemon juice and zest.
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, alternating with the milk, until well combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn it out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Dust with powdered sugar before serving.

name: Cinnamon Rolls
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a baking dish.
In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, and yeast. Add warm milk, melted butter, and eggs. Mix until smooth.
Knead dough on a floured surface for 5-7 minutes. Let rise for 1 hour.
Roll dough into a rectangle, spread melted butter, and sprinkle with brown sugar and cinnamon.
Roll up dough and cut into 12 pieces. Place in the baking dish and bake for 25 minutes.

name: Peach Cobbler
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a baking dish.
In a large bowl, mix the sliced peaches with 1/2 cup of sugar and ground cinnamon. Set aside.
In another bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and remaining sugar.
Stir in the milk and melted butter until a smooth batter forms.
Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish, then spoon the peaches evenly on top.
Bake for 40 minutes or until the top is golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cobbler cool slightly before serving.

name: Slow Cooker Beef Stew
instructions: In a large bowl, coat beef stew meat with flour.
Place meat in the slow cooker and add beef broth, carrots, potatoes, onion, garlic, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Cover and cook on low for 8 hours.
Add frozen peas during the last 30 minutes of cooking.
Serve hot.

name: Slow Cooker Chicken Tikka Masala
instructions: Combine yogurt and tikka masala paste. Coat chicken with the mixture.
Place chicken in the slow cooker with diced tomatoes, onion, and garlic.
Cover and cook on low for 6 hours.
Stir in chopped cilantro before serving.

name: Slow Cooker Lentil Soup
instructions: Place lentils, vegetable broth, carrots, celery, onion, garlic, cumin, salt, and pepper in the slow cooker.
Cover and cook on low for 8 hours.
Serve hot.

name: Slow Cooker Pulled Chicken
instructions: Rub chicken thighs with smoked paprika, salt, and pepper.
Place chicken in the slow cooker with BBQ sauce, apple cider vinegar, onion, and garlic.
Cover and cook on low for 6 hours.
Shred chicken with two forks and mix with cooking juices. Serve with additional BBQ sauce.

name: Gluten-Free Banana Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a loaf pan.
In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking soda, and salt.
Add melted butter, eggs, and mashed bananas. Mix until smooth.
Pour batter into the loaf pan and bake for 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool before slicing.

name: Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, cream together butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
Add egg and vanilla extract. Mix until combined.
Gradually add flour mixture and mix until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls of dough onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 12 minutes, or until edges are golden.
Cool on a wire rack.

name: Gluten-Free Quiche
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Place pie crust in a pie dish.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs and milk. Stir in cheese, bacon, and spinach.
Season with salt and pepper.
Pour mixture into the pie crust and bake for 45 minutes, or until set and golden brown.
Cool slightly before serving.

name: Gluten-Free Pancakes
instructions: In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together milk, egg, and melted butter.
Combine wet and dry ingredients and mix until smooth.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease.
Pour 1/4 cup batter per pancake and cook until bubbles form on the surface. Flip and cook until golden brown.
Serve with your favorite toppings.

name: Mojito
instructions: Place mint leaves and 1 lime wedge into a sturdy glass. Use a muddler to crush the mint and lime to release the mint oils and lime juice.
Add 2 more lime wedges and the sugar, and muddle again to release the lime juice.
Fill the glass almost to the top with ice. Pour the rum over the ice, and fill the glass with soda water. Stir, taste, and add more sugar if desired.
Garnish with the remaining lime wedge and a few mint leaves.

name: Margarita
instructions: Rub the rim of the glass with a lime wedge and dip into salt to coat the rim.
In a shaker filled with ice, combine tequila, triple sec, lime juice, and simple syrup.
Shake well and strain into the prepared glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Old Fashioned
instructions: Place the sugar cube in a glass and add bitters.
Add a splash of water and stir until the sugar is dissolved.
Add whiskey and fill the glass with ice.
Stir until chilled and garnish with an orange twist and maraschino cherry.

name: Cosmopolitan
instructions: In a shaker filled with ice, combine vodka, cranberry juice, triple sec, and lime juice.
Shake well and strain into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with a lime twist.

name: Spicy Roasted Chickpeas
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss chickpeas with olive oil, paprika, cumin, chili powder, and salt.
Spread chickpeas on a baking sheet in a single layer.
Roast for 30 minutes, stirring halfway through, until crispy.
Let cool and serve.

name: Mango Salsa
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine the diced mangoes, red bell pepper, red onion, jalapeño, and cilantro.
Add the lime juice and salt, then toss everything together until well mixed.
Serve immediately with tortilla chips or as a topping for grilled meats.

name: Cheese and Herb Stuffed Mushrooms
ingredients: 2 tbsp chopped fresh herbs (such as parsley and thyme)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, combine cream cheese, Parmesan, herbs, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Stuff the mushroom caps with the cheese mixture.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes, or until mushrooms are tender and filling is golden brown.

name: Hummus with Veggie Sticks
ingredients: Assorted vegetable sticks (carrots, celery, bell peppers, etc.)
instructions: Serve hummus in a bowl with assorted vegetable sticks on the side.
Enjoy as a healthy snack.

name: Couscous with Lamb
instructions: In a large pot, brown lamb with onions over medium heat.
Add carrots, zucchinis, chickpeas, raisins, cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper.
Cover and simmer for 1.5 hours until lamb is tender.
Prepare couscous according to package instructions.
Serve lamb and vegetable mixture over couscous.

name: Brik
instructions: Place a brik pastry sheet on a clean surface.
In the center, place a spoonful of parsley, capers, and tuna.
Crack an egg over the filling.
Fold the pastry to enclose the filling and seal the edges.
Heat oil in a pan and fry each brik until golden and crispy.

name: Lamb Tagine
instructions: In a tagine or large pot, brown lamb with onion and garlic.
Add apricots, almonds, cinnamon, ginger, turmeric, salt, and pepper.
Cover and simmer for 1.5 hours until lamb is tender.
Serve with couscous or rice.

name: Tunisian Harira : HLALEM
instructions: In a large pot, brown lamb with onion and garlic.
Add chickpeas, lentils, tomatoes, cinnamon, ginger, turmeric, salt, and pepper.
Cover and simmer for 1 hour until lamb is tender.
Serve hot.

name: Tunisian Brik (Vegetarian)
instructions: In a bowl, combine chickpeas, parsley, feta cheese, olives, and onions.
Lay out a sheet of brik pastry on a clean surface.
Place a portion of the chickpea mixture in the center of the pastry.
Fold the pastry to enclose the filling and seal the edges with a little water.
Heat vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
Fry each brik until golden brown and crispy, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels and serve warm.

name: Harissa
instructions: Soak dried chilies in warm water for 30 minutes.
Drain and remove stems and seeds.
Blend chilies with garlic, cumin, coriander, and salt until smooth.
Add olive oil and blend again.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

name: Tunisian Mechouia Salad
instructions: Grill tomatoes, bell peppers, and onion until charred.
Peel and chop the grilled vegetables.
In a bowl, mix vegetables with garlic, olive oil, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Serve at room temperature or chilled.

name: Lablabi
instructions: In a pot, sauté onion and garlic until softened.
Add cooked chickpeas, broth, cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper.
Simmer for 45 minutes to 1 hour.
Serve with crusty bread.

name: Omek Houria
instructions: Boil the carrots in salted water until tender, about 20-25 minutes.
Drain the carrots and mash them with garlic, harissa, cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper.
Stir in the lemon juice and drizzle with olive oil.
Garnish with chopped parsley and black olives.
Serve at room temperature with crusty bread.
